radiographic_examinations.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions, left greater than right with minimal atelectasis; 4 mm hypodensity within hepatic segment 6, too small to accurately characterize, stable; 0.8 cm left adrenal nodule, stable; heterogeneous collection in the right upper quadrant adjacent to the second portion of the duodenum measuring 6.9 x 4 x 6.6 cm concerning for developing phlegmon/abscess; moderate wall thickening of segment of sigmoid colon, with tethering and serosal surface tracks, consistent with subacute and intramural abscesses or interloop fistulas; few mildly enlarged lymph nodes, largest measures 0.8 cm; small amount of free fluid in the lower pelvis; persistent fluid-filled right inguinal hernia unchanged.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Interval decrease of the perinephric collection; progressive worsening and increasing organization of the fluid collection since prior.
